entity.name: Piramal Swasthya Management and Research Institute
entity.description:
Piramal Swasthya is committed to bridging public healthcare gaps by supporting and complementing the Government of India’s vision to achieve Universal Health Coverage. Piramal Swasthya focuses on Maternal Health, Child and Adolescent Health, and Non-communicable Diseases as one of India's largest not-for-profit organisations in primary public healthcare. With over a decade of experience, the organization has scaled several healthcare innovations to meet the primary healthcare needs of underserved and marginalized populations across India.

Currently operational in 21 states through 35 innovative public healthcare programs, Piramal Swasthya has served more than 112 million beneficiaries to date.

projects.name: Accessible Medical Records via Integrated Technologies (AMRIT)
projects.description: AMRIT (Accessible Medical Records via Integrated Technologies) is an open-source platform designed to strengthen primary healthcare by empowering frontline health workers with the right digital tools for data-driven decision-making and seamless access to patients' Electronic Health Records (EHR) through ABDM-compliant, interoperable systems.

plans.name: Developer compensation - One time
plans.description: The 2024-25 AMRIT funds will support 6 months of development, enhancing platform capabilities and impact. This includes streamlining operational service delivery, conducting VAPT, and positioning AMRIT as a Digital Public Good (DPG). Funds will also enhance configurability, compliance with health standards, develop a primary care mobile app, and foster data exchange by integrating with government portals like eSanjeevani and Nikshay, bolstering healthcare accessibility and quality in India.

plans.name: Developer compensation - Monthly
plans.description: AMRIT’s 2024-25 funds will enhance platform capabilities and broaden impact by streamlining service delivery, conducting VAPT for security, and positioning AMRIT as a Digital Public Good (DPG).
